name: Saag Meat
history: Saag Meat, a North Indian dish, combines meat (typically mutton) with saag (leafy greens). It's a traditional Punjabi recipe, famous for its rich flavor and nutritious value.
description: Saag Meat is a hearty dish where tender pieces of meat are cooked with spinach and other greens, infused with aromatic spices. It's a perfect blend of meaty richness and the earthiness of greens.

equipment.name: cooking pot
equipment.description: For cooking the meat and saag.

ingredients.item: mutton or lamb, cut into pieces

instructions.title: Cook the Meat
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pot. Add cumin seeds, onions, and ginger-garlic paste. SautÃ© until onions are golden. Add the meat, turmeric, coriander powder, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until meat is browned.

instructions.title: Add Greens
instructions.description: Add chopped spinach and mustard greens to the pot. Pour in enough water to cover the meat. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the meat is tender.

instructions.title: Blend the Greens
instructions.description: Once the meat is cooked, use a blender to puree the greens in the pot, creating a thick gravy.

instructions.title: Add Final Spices
instructions.description: Add chopped tomatoes, green chilies, and garam masala to the pot. Cook for an additional 10 minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with naan or rice.

tips: Cook the meat on low heat for a longer time to make it tender and flavorful.
Adjust the amount of green chilies according to your spice preference.
variations: Substitute mustard greens with other leafy greens like kale or collard greens.
Add a dollop of cream or yogurt for a richer gravy.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish, garnished with a lemon wedge.
Accompany with a side of pickled onions.
